name: Maswik Lodge

reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Maswik Lodge and found it to be clean, close to all the great trails in the National Park and all in all a very good value place to stay.
reviews.title: A good option in the national park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and well looked after but it did get very very close at night. There was a heater, but it was so noisy that the choice was between frozen sleep or a warm but sleepless night.
reviews.title: Maswik hotel food and resturant

likes.liked: — The location was wonderful, and the rooms were small but clean and cozzy and the staff was great.
likes.disliked: — The food at this lodge was horrible. Men and women in jail recevies better food than what was at this lodge.

reviews.text: Maswik Lodge is a very short walk from the rim of the Canyon and a perfect base for hiking. There is a cafeteria, but we found that better food was to be had elsewhere in the park - there are lots of places within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I would certainly return to Maswik Lodge, especially in summer.
reviews.title: Nothing fancy but a good deal

reviews.text: The lodge was a great place to stay. The rooms was small and cozzy. We had a room with a balcony.
reviews.title: Nice Lodge

likes.liked: — 5 minute walk to the canyon rim
likes.disliked: — Roads weren't plowed, sidewalks not shoveled.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We moved here from Kachina Lodge which was a lot closer to the rim but we couldn't get two nights there.
reviews.title: Simplicity at a reasonable price

likes.liked: — It was in a quiet location close to everything

reviews.text: It was fine for a place to sleep - clean, quiet, surrounded by trees but quite basic. However for the price it was very good value. It's reasonably close to everything with plenty of parking spaces.
reviews.title: Nice overnight stay at the Maswik Lodge

likes.disliked: — A bit of a walk to the rim of the Grand Canyon

reviews.text: We ate lunch at the restaurant which was mediocre but breakfast was much better with quite a lot of choice. As a guest at the lodge, you could get free coffees from the restaurant even though there was a coffee machine in the room.
reviews.title: Decent stay inside Grand Canyon Park

reviews.text: We had booked dinner at the El Tovar and were so glad that we had. The dinner there was excellent - good service, lovely surroundings. That's the one problem with staying in the park - you are somewhat limited when it comes to restaurant choices.
reviews.title: A must when you want to stay at the Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the sunset bus tour (free but you need to get there in good time as the queue builds up) which was lovely and we beat all the queues by walking back to the previous bus stop (only 5 mins away).
reviews.title: Average but clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side the location can't be beat; a couple of minutes walk from the Grand Canyon rim.
reviews.title: Good Location
A wonderful surprise.
reviews.text: However, the check-in staff were surly and unhelpful, the room smelt of disinfectant, there was no milk for the coffee (that didn't matter see later), an opened bottle of shower gel was in the waste bin and a bar of used soap was beside the basin, otherwise no toiletries. The coffee maker was sited next to the wash basin with the hand towels danging over it.
The rooom was a good size and the bed was comfy.
reviews.title: Not the Ritz but Worth it

reviews.text: In the morning I found the coffee maker wouldn't work. I walked over to reception to report it (and to buy some coffees from the self-service). Receptionist told me to unplug the machine wait 20 seconds, plug it back in and try again. I pointout that the plug was behing the fridge and received a shrug in response. I returned to my room and followed the instructions. When I tried to turn the coffee maker on there was a bang and a flash of sparks, the coffee maker still didn't work. I phoned reception to tell them and was told maintenance would come and have a look. No appology. When maintenance did turn up he said it would need to be replaced (no kidding!) but he would have to order one as he didn't have a spare!
reviews.title: Awesome! Everything except the food at Maswik!

likes.liked: — Near the rim in a wooded area

reviews.text: Just as well we were leaving anyway.
reviews.title: Cabins at Maswik Lodge

likes.liked: — Very close to the rim, yet quiet

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night in May. The price was very reasonable for being inside the park and so close to the rim. There are 4 cabin rooms in each cabin building. My traveling companions enjoyed the cabins and felt that it was a more historic/authentic experience compared to a motel room. This was especially true when we woke up to 3 inches of snow right outside the door in the morning!
reviews.title: Maswik Lodge Cabin - Interesting Experience

likes.liked: — It's a different experience from motels/hotels
likes.disliked: — It's a different experience from motels/hotels

reviews.text: Maswik Lodge has a cafeteria (good prices & variety) and was close to shuttle stops and within a short walking distance to the rim. The only complaint I might have is that although the heater had a dial from 1 to 9, it either shuts off completely at 3 or is blazingly hot at 4+. The shower was definitely adequate and bath linens seem quite new. Outdoorsy types such as some of my traveling companions appreciated these cabins more than I did, but I at least found it interesting/unusual for one night.
reviews.title: great location for rim

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here one night any more and i would have had to complain room was on an upper floor bathroom was not very clean the bath looked like it was beyond cleaning needed replaced room had not been cleaned properly crumbs on floor behind drawers ate at the lodge it was fine good selection on menu although its location was great a short walk to the rim no lights to get you back to your room remember to pack a flash light
reviews.title: Fine Accomodations
Maswik Lodge
reviews.text: If you're planning to spend multiple days at the Grand Canyon you'll probably want to stay in the park to maximize your stay. We found the Maswik lodge to be clean and quiet, while very close to the rim. If we had anything other than ice cold water in the shower (we did have hot water at the sink) we'd be able to give a higher rating. When we brought the issue to the attention of the front desk when we were checking out (one night stay) their response was that they would look into it, with further push back they did discount our stay to our satifaction. All in all, if I were to visit the Grand Canyon in the future I would stay here again. (However, I would not recommend the Maswik cafeteria unless you're limiting your selections to beverages, salads, cereals, yogurt, and other non-cafeteria prepared items.)

We stayed at the Maswik Lodge for two nights. The hotel is clean and quiet, away from the droves of people that stay at the hotels on the rim, yet still close to the rim. It is only a short walk through the trees to get to the rim and trails. On our second day we walked the entire rim trail, about 10 miles, and found the bed to be much more comfortable when you are really tired. Otherwise, it is just your standard hard hotel bed. There is a cafeteria at this hotel which was ok. The food was tasty, but a little pricey. We were glad that we had purchased a cooler and food when we got off the plane. The room did have a small refrigerator and coffee maker, but not a microwave.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

likes.disliked: — Somewhat pricey at $162 for a Maswik North room

aka: Maswik Hotel Grand Canyon National Park
